Delhi polls: Congress announces scheme for unemployed youth, promises ₹8500 per month - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Elections: Congress Unveils 'Yuva Udaan Yojana' for Unemployed Youth

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress party has announced the 'Yuva Udaan Yojana' scheme to provide ₹8,500 monthly for one year to unemployed youth in Delhi, contingent on their election victory.

  • The scheme targets educated yet unemployed youth.
  • Beneﬁciaries are required to demonstrate their skills through work placements.
  • This initiative is part of a broader campaign including the 'Pyari Didi Yojana' and 'Jeevan Raksha Yojana'.
  • Polling for Delhi assembly elections is set for February 5, 2025.
“We will provide financial assistance to youths who can show their skills in a company, factory or organisation.” - Sachin Pilot

The announcement signifies the Congress's attempt to regain influence in a region where they have not held power since 2013.
newTitle: Delhi Elections: Congress Unveils 'Yuva Udaan Yojana' for Unemployed Youth

Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Uttar Pradesh Police have implemented extensive security arrangements for the upcoming Mahakumbh in Prayagraj, expecting over 45 crore visitors. With the event set to occur from January 13 to February 26, authorities are focused on ensuring safety through a multi-layered security system.

  • The police have established a circular security system with 102 checkpoints along major routes.
  • Over 1,000 police personnel, including multiple inspectors and constables, are deployed for comprehensive safety.
  • Advanced technologies such as drones and AI cameras are integrated into the security measures.
  • Mock drills involving NSG and ATS have been conducted to prepare for potential threats.
  • Key dates for major bathing rituals include January 14, January 29, and February 3, coinciding with auspicious occasions.
“We are committed to ensuring the safety of all participants,” said DGP Prashant Kumar.

As the Mahakumbh approaches, the multi-layered security framework seeks to provide peace of mind for millions attending this massive religious gathering at the Sangam.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025: Advanced Security Measures in Place for Record-Breaking Attendance
